entries_to_fix.comment: A separator text between quality and category.
A quoted comment from a user, displayed in italic font within a VStack. The text inside the quotation marks is automatically escaped for display as plain text.
A separator between the owned and required quantities of a resource.
A badge displaying the index of an item in a list. The argument is the index as a string.
A label displaying the number of territories the user currently owns. The argument is the count of territories the user owns.
A label displaying the time required to build a building. The argument is the number of seconds needed to build the building.
A bullet point symbol.
A label displaying the quantity of a specific item in the user's cart. The argument is the quantity of the item in the cart.
Text shown when a verification code has been sent to the user's registered email address.
Text shown in the "Resend code" button, indicating the countdown timer.
Format string for displaying the time remaining until a building is fully constructed.
Language name for English.
A description of a database error that might occur when trading. The argument is a message from the database that describes the error.
A small label below the user's name that shows their user ID in a shortened form.
Placeholder text for the text field in the "Delete Account" confirmation screen.

entries_to_fix.new_en: Are you sure you want to delete your profile?
entries_to_fix.new_zh: 您确定要删除个人资料吗？
entries_to_fix.comment: Prompt displayed in an alert when confirming the deletion of a user account.
Label for a button that, when tapped, displays the current configuration of the app.
Label for a debug action in the trade screen that fills the user's entire inventory with a specific item.
Label for the count of items in the user's inventory in the debug tools.
Label for a button that triggers a test to populate the in-memory database with sample data.
Title of the debug tools section in the trade view.
A label displaying the quantity of a specific item in the scavenge result. The argument is the quantity of the item.
